reviews.review_msg: It is currently my last semester at SFU and I am so grateful that I was able to enroll in Amin's BUS 465 course as a final goodbye to SFU. Along with being the most understanding professor, he is very knowledgeable and one of the most technical professors I have met. Overall 10/10 professor!! Thank you, Amin!

Course content is a bit technical but he only tests you on the basics stuff, lab assignments are so easy it takes 5 minutes to complete, and he's easy on marking assignments and exams. One of the most enjoyable group project since he let's you make any web app you want, and teaches you basic HTML, CSS, JS, PHP, MySQL, etc.

I took 2 classes with Amin and learned a lot of useful skills from both! He is laid back and grades fairly, but averages tend to be super high. Regardless, easy A if you do above average. His exams can get more technical because his background is CMPT so bonus if you have previous experience. Overall he's one of my favorite profs at SFU :D

Amin is very personable, however he should not be teaching in the business faculty. He did not differentiate the marks at the end of the semester, and literally gave everyone the same grades on all the assignments and projects regardless of individual effort. He skips over important concepts in lecture, and can be condensending.
